title: Soyuz MS-19 to land in Kazakhstan amid tense U.S.-Russian relations
summary: At 07:21 UTC on March 30, Soyuz MS-19 will undock from the International Space Station (ISS) and subsequently land on the Kazakh Steppe around 11:29 UTC later that day. This will conclude a five-month mission for the spacecraft, and the second-ever one-year mission by an American astronaut.

title: Pixxel raises $25 million for hyperspectral imaging constellation
summary: Indian startup Pixxel said March 28 it has raised $25 million for a hyperspectral imaging constellation that plans to deploy its first satellite this week.

title: NASA contracts SpaceX for a second crewed Starship Moon landing
summary: In an oddly roundabout and confusing manner, NASA appears to have confirmed that it exercised a contract option to purchase a second...

title: NASA Names Winners of Lunar Robotics Design Contest
summary: NASA has chosen two students as winners of the Lunabotics Junior Contest, a national competition for K-12 students featuring the agency’s Artemis missions.

title: Lockheed Martin signs deal to use SpiderOak cybersecurity to protect satellite networks
summary: SpiderOak Mission Systems announced March 29 it won a contract from Lockheed Martin Space for its cybersecurity software.

title: Singapore signs the Artemis Accords
summary: Singapore has become the 18th country to join the U.S.-led Artemis Accords for space exploration, hoping to use the agreement to enhance its nascent domestic space industry.

title: Impulse Space is betting on a future where launch is cheap
summary: "What happens to space if the cost of access to space is essentially free?"

title: China launches first Long March rocket with solid boosters
summary: China launched its first Long March 6A from a new launch complex at Taiyuan Tuesday, successfully sending two satellites into sun-synchronous orbits.

title: Synspective raises $100 million Series B round
summary: Japanese startup Synspective announced March 29 it raised $100 million to continue its development of a constellation of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellites.

title: SpaceX gears up for busiest April yet
summary: SpaceX says it’s finished encapsulating 40 spacecraft inside a Falcon 9 rocket’s payload fairing, paving the way for the company’s fourth Transporter...
